identificationModule.briefTitle: Interstage Monitoring Using an Implantable Loop Recorder: A Pilot Study
identificationModule.officialTitle: Interstage Monitoring Using an Implantable Loop Recorder: A Pilot Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The primary objective of this investigation is to evaluate the feasibility and safety of implantable loop recorder implantation (using the LUX-DX™) in newborns undergoing stage 1 palliation. The secondary objective of the investigation is to evaluate the feasibility of continuous measurement of heart rate and arrhythmia using an implantable loop recorder (LUX-Dx™) during the interstage period.

An implantable loop recorder will be placed at the time of chest closure following stage 1 palliation (either at the time of index surgery or delayed). The device will be placed in a subclavicular pouch through the existing sternotomy incision. Participants will be in the study for 6 months to 3 years.

interventions.name: LUX-Dx™
interventions.description: Placement of LUX-Dx at the time of stage 1 palliation

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients with successful ILR implantation at the time of surgery
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the time of stage 1 surgery, typically the first week of life

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients with ILR related complication (any of: infection, erosion, device migration, foreign body rejection phenomena, formation of hematomas or seromas, local tissue reaction and/or tissue damage
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Between the stage 1 and stage 2 surgery, typically until 4-6 months of age

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patient who completed >70% planned ILR transmissions
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Between the stage 1 and stage 2 surgery, typically until 4-6 months of age

secondaryOutcomes.description: Any arrhythmia, including supraventricular tachycardia, junctional ectopic tachycardia, ventricular tachycardia, atrioventricular block, pause \>2.5 seconds
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Between the stage 1 and stage 2 surgery, typically until 4-6 months of age

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients with interstage complication
secondaryOutcomes.description: Any complication, including unplanned emergency department visit, unscheduled hospital admission, unscheduled intensive care unit admission, arrhythmias, major interstage intervention, minor interstage intervention, cardiac arrest, death
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Between the stage 1 and stage 2 surgery, typically until 4-6 months of age

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Complications at the time of ILR removal
secondaryOutcomes.description: Defined as easily removed, removed with difficulty, removed with complication
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At stage 2 or 3 palliation, typically between 4 months and 4 years of age

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients with single ventricle physiology undergoing stage 1 palliation in the 1st month of life

Exclusion Criteria:

* Prematurity (\<36 weeks gestational age)
* Birth weight \<2.5 kg
* Hybrid stage 1 palliation (patent ductus arteriosus stenting, bilateral pulmonary artery bands)
* Presence and/or need for devices sensitive to magnetic fields such as hearing aids, pacemaker, and other implanted devices.
* Clinical team does not think that the patient is a good candidate
